goal.en: The sociology of gender course focuses on teaching and introducing the development of gender issues, covering topics such as the social construction and differences of gender, gender temperament, labor and employment, political participation, intimate relationships, gender and the body, and digital gender. The course includes lectures on relevant theories and further leads students to discuss the latest development trends in gender-related events and issues in daily life. Simone de Beauvoir‘s famous quote, “One is not born, but rather becomes, a woman,“ underscores that we are not born women but are gradually shaped into women, and the same applies to men. Every society treats gender differently and has different norms and behavior patterns. The main goal of sociology of gender is to explore the social gender differences presented by societal constructions, how they are shaped by culture and social structures, how they affect individuals, and how we can practice different gender structures. This course will adopt an interactive dialogue approach to discuss and analyze current social gender issues and gender-related policies, understanding the latest developments in gender policy. Ultimately, the course will use a situational design to help students understand specific, diverse gender contexts, enhance gender sensitivity, comprehend the state of gender intertwined with different social structures, and grasp gender-related policies.
goal.ch: 性別社會學課程著重於講授與介紹性別議題之發展，探討課題包含性別之社會型構與差異、性別氣質、勞動與就業、政治參與、親密關係、性別與身體、數位性別等領域，進行相關理論講授，並進一步帶領學生討論日常生活的性別相關事件與議題最新的發展趨勢。西蒙波娃名言：On ne naît pas femme, on le devient，我們非天生為女人，而是被逐漸塑造而成女人。男性亦同。每個社會都以不同方式來對待性別，並有不同的規範與行為模式。性別社會學主要在探究社會形構的性別所呈現的社會性別差異，如何受到文化與社會結構的形塑，如何對個體產生影響，以及我們可以如何讓性別結構有不同的實踐。本課程將採互動對話方式，對目前社會性別議題與性別相關政策，進行討論與分析，了解最新的性別政策發展方向。最終，本課程將以情境式設計，讓同學理解特定的、多元的性別處境脈絡，提升性別敏感度，了解性別與不同的社會結構交織後的狀態，以及對性別相關政策的掌握。
